tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Passionate about the subject matter, but lectures can become very boring. Probably best to sit close to the front to keep awake. Be VERY careful with how you write for essays and exams. She\'s pretty picky when it comes to writing errors. Book readings not necessarily required, but online readings are necessary for participation credit.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Mazzi is a great professor, I saw a negative review of her and disagree strongly. She\'s clear and passionate about this course, Global Baroque. This is her first time teaching the class she created and I love it. She expects you to come to class and do the reading, not unrealistic, good grader, exams are godsent. Loved this class!

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: She is INCREDIBLY boring, several people fell asleep in class each day. She doesnt tell you anything that isn\'t in the textbook and frequently has to look up information because she gets confused, forgot or just didn\'t know. I would suggest not taking her class if you don\'t have to.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: I found her class to be incredibly interesting and her enthusiasm for the subject is ovious in her teaching style and the exaples she uses during class!

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Her lectures tend to be pretty boring, but she definitely loves the subject. She is can be a pretty difficult grader so make sure to put as much info as possible in your exams and essay! It wasn\'t too much work and I definitely could have gotten an A if I studied more for the midterm. In the end I don\'t regret taking the class.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: During the lectures I had a difficult time staying engaged. She is a surprisingly tough grader, so be careful taking her tests/writing essays. Just put as MUCH info on the paper as you can. I would not take a class with her again.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Great professor! Very nice and enthusiastic about the subject. Very helpful in office hours. Class isn\'t too hard, only one short paper. Exams are essay questions, but they are given to you before the test. I would definitely take another class wiht her!

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: I loved her class. Course structure, quizzes, short paper, and exams were simple enough. She was very much straight to the point with occasional cute little quirky comments here and there.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: I found her to be very approachable and helpful whenever I had questions about tests and papers. Gave me sources and helped with thesis for a paper. Very nice and passionate. Pretty easy slide ids, relatively easy with papers, attendance and participation important. no interest in class and now I am taking another latin am art class

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Fascinating topic and beautiful textbook. Doing the readings honestly enhances your view of the class. Lectures started dry but tended to get better as the semester progressed. Wonderful professor and very helpful and knowledgeable during office hours.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Mazzi is not bad. 12 images to memorize, qst for exam given before, EASY! Sometimes picky with style of writing. Very interested in the topic. Not enough research on most of the subject so at times she seems unsure. I thought overall she is easy, sometimes a little dull. Nice professor

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: If you have any respect for the Art hist-please don\'t bother with her. Even if you memorize her SKEWED version of the facts, she will take off points and grade you down-Is elusive if you confront her about grades and doesn\'t seem to know the material. Only professor I have ever evaluated as poor! DO NOT TAKE! Subject was interesting, she is NOT!

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Thank God I took ARH2051 first, otherwise this woman would have killed my interest in declaring an Art History minor. This woman can bore anyone to sleep; oh well, at least the class was easy. All you need to do is read the textbook and study the images. Nothing else. The textbook is more interesting than her.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Very nice professor. You can tell she loves art history and gets excited about teaching it. Tests weren\'t too hard but you have to memorize a lot of images and everything is fill in the blank. Don\'t really need the book at all as long as you go to class and take notes.
